SEARCH
Package aor.fpbackend.bean

Class SkillBean

java.lang.Object
aor.fpbackend.bean.SkillBean
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class SkillBean extends Object implements Serializable
SkillBean is a stateless EJB that manages the operations related to skills. It interacts with various DAOs to perform CRUD operations on skill entities, user entities, and project entities. This bean handles the addition, update, deletion, and retrieval of skills associated with users and projects.
Technologies Used:
  • Jakarta EE: For dependency injection and EJB management.
  • SLF4J: For logging operations.


Dependencies are injected using the EJB annotation, which includes DAOs for user, skill, and project entities. The bean also uses utility classes for logging and ensures that transactions are handled appropriately.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • addSkillUser

      public void addSkillUser(SkillAddUserDto skillAddUserDto, @Context jakarta.ws.rs.core.SecurityContext securityContext) throws DuplicatedAttributeException, DatabaseOperationException
      Adds a skill to the authenticated user's skill set.
      This method ensures the skill exists (creating it if necessary), and then associates the skill with the authenticated user. If the user already possesses the skill, a DuplicatedAttributeException is thrown.

      The method uses logging to track the process and catches any persistence exceptions to handle database-related errors.
      Parameters:
      skillAddUserDto - The DTO containing the skill name and type to add.
      securityContext - The security context containing the authenticated user's information.
      Throws:
      DuplicatedAttributeException - if the user already has the specified skill or if the skill already has the user.
      DatabaseOperationException

    • addSkillProject

      public void addSkillProject(String skillName, SkillTypeEnum type, long projectId) throws DuplicatedAttributeException, DatabaseOperationException, ElementAssociationException, EntityNotFoundException
      Adds a skill to a specified project.
      This method ensures that the skill exists (creating it if necessary), associates the skill with the specified project, and updates the skill's list of projects. If the project already possesses the skill, a DuplicatedAttributeException is thrown.

      The method uses logging to track the process and catches any persistence exceptions to handle database-related errors.
      Parameters:
      skillName - The name of the skill to add.
      type - The type of the skill.
      projectId - The ID of the project to which the skill will be added.
      Throws:
      DuplicatedAttributeException - if the project already has the specified skill or if the skill already has the project.
      DatabaseOperationException
      ElementAssociationException
      EntityNotFoundException

    • getSkills

      public List<SkillGetDto> getSkills() throws DatabaseOperationException
      Retrieves a list of all skills in the system.
      This method fetches all skill entities from the database and converts them into a list of SkillGetDto objects for easier handling and presentation in the application layer.

      Logging is used to track the process, and any database-related errors are caught and rethrown as a DatabaseOperationException.
      Returns:
      a list of SkillGetDto representing all skills in the system.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - if there is an error while fetching the skills from the database.

    • getSkillsByUser

      public List<SkillGetDto> getSkillsByUser(String username) throws EntityNotFoundException, DatabaseOperationException
      Retrieves a list of skills associated with a specific user.
      This method performs the following steps:
      • Fetches the list of skills associated with the specified username from the database.
      • Converts the list of skill entities to a list of SkillGetDto objects.
      • Logs the number of skills fetched for the specified user.


      Logging is used to track the process, and any database-related errors are caught and rethrown as a DatabaseOperationException.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user whose skills are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      a list of SkillGetDto representing the skills associated with the specified user.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if no skills are associated with the specified user.
      DatabaseOperationException - if there is an error while fetching the skills from the database.

    • getSkillsByFirstLetter

      public List<SkillGetDto> getSkillsByFirstLetter(String firstLetter) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Retrieves a list of skills whose names start with a specified letter.
      This method performs the following steps:
      • Validates the input to ensure it is a single alphabetical character.
      • Converts the input to lowercase to ensure case-insensitive matching.
      • Fetches the list of skills from the database that start with the specified letter.
      • Converts the list of skill entities to a list of SkillGetDto objects.
      • Logs the number of skills fetched for the specified letter.


      Logging is used to track the process, and any database-related errors are caught and rethrown as a DatabaseOperationException.
      Parameters:
      firstLetter - the letter to filter skills by.
      Returns:
      a list of SkillGetDto representing the skills starting with the specified letter, or an empty list if the input is invalid.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - if there is an error while fetching the skills from the database.

    • getSkillsByProject

      public List<SkillGetDto> getSkillsByProject(long projectId) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Retrieves a list of skills associated with a specific project.
      This method performs the following steps:
      • Fetches the list of skills associated with the specified project ID from the database.
      • Converts the list of skill entities to a list of SkillGetDto objects.
      • Logs the number of skills fetched for the specified project ID.


      Logging is used to track the process, and any database-related errors are caught and rethrown as a DatabaseOperationException.
      Parameters:
      projectId - the ID of the project whose skills are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      a list of SkillGetDto representing the skills associated with the specified project.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - if there is an error while fetching the skills from the database.

    • getEnumListSkillTypes

      public List<SkillTypeEnum> getEnumListSkillTypes()
      Retrieves a list of all skill type enumerations.
      This method performs the following steps:
      • Creates a new list to hold the SkillTypeEnum values.
      • Iterates over all values of the SkillTypeEnum enumeration and adds them to the list.
      • Logs the retrieval of the skill type enumerations.


      Logging is used to track the process.
      Returns:
      a list of SkillTypeEnum representing all possible skill types.

    • removeSkillUser

      public void removeSkillUser(SkillRemoveUserDto skillRemoveUserDto, @Context jakarta.ws.rs.core.SecurityContext securityContext) throws UserNotFoundException, EntityNotFoundException
      Removes a skill from a user's list of skills.
      This method performs the following steps:
      • Retrieves the authenticated user's details from the security context.
      • Validates the existence of the user and skill.
      • Removes the skill from the user's list of skills.
      • Removes the user from the skill's list of users.
      • Logs the successful removal of the skill from the user.


      Logging is used to track the process.
      Parameters:
      skillRemoveUserDto - the DTO containing the skill ID to be removed from the user.
      securityContext - the security context containing the authenticated user's details.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the authenticated user is not found.
      EntityNotFoundException - if the skill is not found.

    • removeSkillProject

      public void removeSkillProject(SkillRemoveProjectDto skillRemoveProjectDto) throws EntityNotFoundException
      Removes a skill from a project's list of skills.

      This method performs the following steps:

      • Retrieves the project entity using the project ID from the DTO.
      • Retrieves the skill entity using the skill ID from the DTO.
      • Removes the skill from the project's list of skills.
      • Removes the project from the skill's list of projects.
      • Logs the successful removal of the skill from the project.

      Logging is used to track the process, and thread context is cleared after execution.

      Parameters:
      skillRemoveProjectDto - the DTO containing the skill ID and project ID.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if the project or skill is not found.

    • convertSkillEntitytoSkillDto

      public SkillGetDto convertSkillEntitytoSkillDto(SkillEntity skillEntity)
      Converts a SkillEntity object to a SkillGetDto object.
      Parameters:
      skillEntity - the SkillEntity object to be converted.
      Returns:
      a SkillGetDto object populated with the data from the SkillEntity.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the skillEntity is null.

    • convertSkillEntityListToSkillDtoList

      public List<SkillGetDto> convertSkillEntityListToSkillDtoList(List<SkillEntity> skillEntities)
      Converts a list of SkillEntity objects to a list of SkillGetDto objects.
      Parameters:
      skillEntities - the list of SkillEntity objects to be converted.
      Returns:
      a list of SkillGetDto objects populated with the data from the SkillEntity objects.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the input list is null.
